Dear Cantera Users:

I wonder if anyone has been successful in parametrizi=
ng the
set.molefraction() function in Python. I mean, instead of give the
c=
omposition as:

gas.set(T =3D 900.0, P =3D 1.0e5, X =3D 'CH4:1,O2:2,N2:7.52=
')

We could give something like:

gas1.set(T =3D 900.0, P =3D 1.0e5, X =3D=
 'CH4:mole_CH4,O2:mole_O2,N2:mole_N2')

Where mole_CH4, mole_O2 and mole_N2=
 are previously calculated as a
function of the fuel injection rate, mass a=
ir flow and equivalence
ratio. Any hint or experience on this will be much =
appreciated. Thank
you very much for your kind attention.

Best Regards, Pe=
ter
